app.core.dataset_handler module

app.core.dataset_handler.artifact_to_dataset(artifact: Artifact) → Dataset[source]

Converts an Artifact object to a Dataset object. :param artifact: The Artifact object to be converted. :type artifact: Artifact

Returns:

A new Dataset object created from the given Artifact.

Return type:

Dataset

app.core.dataset_handler.ask_for_input(text: str, default: str | None = None) → str[source]

Displays a text input widget and returns the user’s input. :param text: The label for the text input widget. :type text: str :param default: The default value for the text :type default: Optional[str], optional :param input. Defaults to None.:

Returns:

The user’s input as a string.

Return type:

str

app.core.dataset_handler.choose_dataset(datasets: List[Artifact]) → Dataset[source]

Prompts the user to select a dataset from a list of datasets and returns the selected dataset.

Parameters:

  • datasets (List['Artifact']) – A list of Artifact objects representing

  • datasets. (available)

Returns:

The selected dataset converted from the chosen Artifact.

Return type:

Dataset

Returns:

None

app.core.dataset_handler.save_csv(automl: AutoMLSystem, file: UploadedFile) → None[source]

This function reads the uploaded CSV file, shows a preview of the data, and prompts the user to enter a dataset name and asset path. It then saves the dataset to the AutoML system using the provided name and asset path. Args:

automl (AutoMLSystem): The AutoML system instance where the dataset will be saved. file (st.uploaded_file_manager.UploadedFile): The uploaded CSV file to be saved.

Returns:

None

app.core.dataset_handler.save_df_to_dataset_button(automl: AutoMLSystem, name: str, data: DataFrame, asset_path: str) → None[source]

Displays a button in the Streamlit app to save a DataFrame as a dataset and register it with the AutoML system. :param automl: The AutoML system instance to register :type automl: AutoMLSystem :param the dataset with.: :param name: The name of the dataset. :type name: str :param data: The DataFrame containing the dataset. :type data: pd.DataFrame :param asset_path: The file path where the dataset asset will be saved. :type asset_path: str

Returns:

None

app.core.dataset_handler.show_preview(text: str, data: DataFrame) → None[source]

Displays a preview of the given DataFrame along with a text description. :param text: The text description to display. :type text: str :param data: The DataFrame to preview. :type data: pd.DataFrame

Returns:

None

app.core.dataset_handler.slice_data_accordion(automl: AutoMLSystem, datasets: List[Artifact]) → None[source]

Displays a Streamlit interface for slicing a dataset based on user-defined criteria.

Parameters:

  • automl (AutoMLSystem) – The AutoML system instance.

  • datasets (List[Artifact]) – A list of dataset artifacts to choose from.

Raises:

  • Exception – If there is an error in slicing the data based on the

  • provided criteria. –

file.

app.core.deployment_handler.preprocess_data(dataset: Artifact, pipeline: Pipeline) → ndarray[source]

Preprocesses the data by detecting feature types, validating pipeline input features, and concatenating input vectors into a compact observation vector. :param dataset: The dataset to be preprocessed. :type dataset: Artifact :param pipeline: The pipeline containing the input features and :type pipeline: Pipeline :param execution logic.:

Returns:

The compact observation vector after preprocessing.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the input features of the pipeline are not present in

  • the new data. –

Prompts the user to select metrics from a predefined list and returns the selected metrics. :returns: A list of selected metrics. :rtype: list[‘Metric’]

app.core.modelling_handler.choose_model(model_type: str) → Model[source]

Choose a machine learning model based on the specified model type. :param model_type: The type of model to choose. Can be either :type model_type: str :param “Regression” or “Classification”.:

Returns:

An instance of the selected machine learning model.

Return type:

Model

app.core.modelling_handler.choose_target_column(dataset: Dataset) → str[source]

Returns:

The name of the selected target column.

Return type:

str

app.core.modelling_handler.determine_task_type(target_feature: Feature, target_column: Series) → str[source]

Determines the type of machine learning task based on the target feature. :param target_feature: The target feature for which the task type :type target_feature: Feature :param is to be determined.: :param target_column: The column data of the target feature. :type target_column: pd.Series

Returns:

The type of task, either ‘Classification’ if the target feature is categorical, or ‘Regression’ if the target feature is numerical.

Return type:

str

app.core.modelling_handler.display_pipeline_results(results: dict, pipeline: Pipeline) → None[source]

Display the pipeline results using Streamlit. :param results: A dictionary containing the results of the pipeline.

It should have the following keys: - ‘metrics’: The performance metrics of the pipeline. - ‘predictions’: The predictions made by the pipeline.

Returns:

None

app.core.modelling_handler.display_pipeline_summary(pipeline: Pipeline, name: str = 'Summary') → None[source]

Returns:

None

app.core.modelling_handler.generate_target_and_input_features(dataset: Dataset, target_column: str, input_columns: list[str]) → tuple[Feature, list[Feature]][source]

Generates the target feature and input features from the given dataset. :param dataset: The dataset from which to extract features. :type dataset: Dataset :param target_column: The name of the target column. :type target_column: str :param input_columns: A list of column names to be used as input :type input_columns: list[str] :param features.:

Returns:

A tuple containing the target feature and a list of input features.

Return type:

tuple[Feature, list[Feature]]

app.core.modelling_handler.save_pipeline_button(automl: AutoMLSystem, pipeline: Pipeline) → None[source]

Displays a button to save a machine learning pipeline using Streamlit. This function renders a Streamlit interface to save a given machine learning pipeline. It prompts the user to input a name for the pipeline and provides a button to save the pipeline using pickle. Upon successful saving, a success message is displayed. :param automl: The AutoML system instance that manages the :type automl: AutoMLSystem :param pipeline registry.: :param pipeline: The machine learning pipeline to be saved. :type pipeline: Pipeline

Returns:

None

app.core.modelling_handler.write_helper_text(text: str) → None[source]

Writes the given text to the Streamlit app with a specific style. :param text: The text to be written in the Streamlit app. :type text: str

Returns:

None

Module contents

Includes all necessary functionality that the pages package needs to run the AutoML application.
